heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 23 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 7th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 7 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 18 October 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 9 mbar) and rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.4 mm) and cloud levels (up 217 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 153.2m higher than yesterday, 110.7m higher than the past week, 216.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 791m and a peak of 1764m, averaging 1199.1m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (92%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
